m_szDocSumamry: Rechargeable anion battery cell using a molten salt electrolyte US 20140295295 A1 Abstract A rechargeable electrochemical battery cell includes a molten carbonate salt electrolyte whose anion transports oxygen between a metal electrode and an air electrode on opposite sides of the electrolyte, where the molten salt electrolyte is retained inside voids of a porous electrolyte supporting structure sandwiched by the electrodes, and the molten salt includes carbonate including at least one of the alkaline carbonate including Li2Co2, NA2CO2, and K2CO2, having a melting point between 400Â° C. and 800
